body.name: Steady As She Goes: A Jesse McDermitt Novel (Caribbean Adventure Series Book 21)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wayne always brings the best of Jesse
reviews.reviewText: I've been hooked on the Jesse McDermott series of books since I read the first one. It's really awesome to follow Jesse as Wayne lays out each additional adventure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another Home Run
reviews.reviewText: Another Home Run. Boring I know. One reason I love this author is because he is a great writer. And he is influenced by the great John D MacDonald who wrote the Travis McGee series back in the day. When that author died, I was stationed in Turkey as a young 2 striper in the Air Force. My Mom wrote me a letter (no computer back then) and broke the bad news to me. John D had written the Lonely Silver Rain and told us of his discovery of the long lost daughter he never knew he had, (he being Travis). So now we have Jesse who has discovered his family, but not too late. And now we explore that dynamic, something Travis did not get to do. So thank you Wayne. Another great novel. John D would be proud. For you readers who are looking for a new book, a new series, a new author? Read this book but first? Order the previous 20 or so. I'm a 57 year old dude who has read a great many novels. And many authors. Get this book, followo this dude, and read all his stuff. He's a stud. Highly recommend. What's it about? An X Gunny who has been there and done that. From an old retired Master Sergeant? You can't find a better author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A transition to new characters and drinking game
reviews.reviewText: In this “chapter” of Jesse’s life, some new characters will appear and at least one will leave. So this is sort of a transition story and as such, I’d cut Jesse some slack for not being all action figure. His responsibilities are larger than personal scale balancing.Some good news - for those of you who were getting thirsty because his boat wasn’t “going on plane” (take a drink) as much in his last couple of stories, now you can transition to taking a drink each time he “puts his cover (hat) on the table”.If you do, make sure you don’t have to drive anywhere while reading this episode.As far as intrigue, there are several places where you will be pulled forward to find out exactly who, of several possibilities, is in danger. What will happen next, etc.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Things change once again...
reviews.reviewText: In the 22nd book chronicling the life, times, crusades and fights of Jesse McDermitt, he's making adjustments . He and his wife are now parents to a nine year old boy, he's now captain of a 199 foot yacht belonging to uber wealthy Jack Armstrong, whose foundation combines marine research with crime fighting, he has an expanded crew with new responsibilities, and the man he looked up to for years is dying.Be advised - if you've ever lost a loved one, you'll be moved to tears. And if you've ever been witness to marriage proposals, you'll giggle. Nice touches as Jesse ages and realized he's got others to do for him. That's where Stinnett might have done a more thorough job - dealing with the transition from single/solitary to leader/group. Twenty one books of the guy being fiercely independent and in one book he's fully evolved? Could have used a litt!e more work.But there are the usual things that show up in McDermott stories: a fascination with weapons, military history, damsels in distress and rescued. And a promise of more to come - with a bigger boat!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Review of, “Steady As She Goes’
reviews.reviewText: Another great continuing story of Jesse, Savannah and their new son Roberto now living aboard Ambrosia, the 199 foot yacht that he Captains. Jesse and his intrepid crew are searching for a ghost ship off the coast of north eastern South America that is reported to be kidnapping women and children and some young men and selling them as slaves in the Mideast. Evil lurks along with danger as the Ambrosia continues on its patrol. One noble character, Tank Tankersley and his wife visit Ambrosia as his health worsens.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Again and Again and Again
reviews.reviewText: Jesse McDermitt is a man who has led a life rich in adventure, danger, and patriotic duty. His story has grown over the years, spawning spin-offs as the number of people introduced into his storylines outgrew their roles as Jesse sidekicks. They had stories if their own to tell. Jesse, himself, has spawned this new series because there's just too much of Jesse McDermitt to keep on the same course. Jesse is older now, wiser and more experienced. He needed a bigger stage to play on. If you want to get the full experience of Jesse and the other players that point out what it really means to be American, start at book one and grow with Jesse and his friends.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I will not ruin the book for you!! This one moved me to tears. It was a great tribute to the love and friendships that we as humans can have or feel for each other whether related by blood or by choice. I found myself wondering how his friends from previous books were doing while welcoming getting a feel for his new circle of friends. Loved the new Or is it the old relationship Charity and Jesse has. I feel that this is easily one of the best books in this series. I couldn’t put it down and had to call in late for work the next day. Can’t wait for the next one!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I have all Jesse McDermitt Fallen and Rising books 1 thru the last one. I have only now started this new one because I'm not sure how I'm feeling about a new venue away from his island, his life there and all his "keys" character friends we've come to know. I started this series because I have lived in Florida for 50 plus years and I know and love the places he hangs out. Although these books are fiction, they are all very real to those of us who hang out here too. So I am reserving judgement until I finish this book.
I love reading all of the Jessie books. Only problem is they are way to short. I need double the pages☺☺☺

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as previous Jesse McDermott stories,,,
reviews.reviewText: I'm in two minds about this book. I enjoyed the story, but it lacked some of the pizazz of previous books. Seems a 'toned down' version of Jesse is now the new normal. Did he get old, or did I?
new characters and some good old ones...good mix, nice easy reading...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 23, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I have now read nearly all the Jesse McDermott books and everyone has provided a great plot. Great descriptions of the places visited and we'll described characters. There is normally fast paced action which is also well described. The only slight complaint I have is that I thought the ending was a bit game.However I did enjoy the book.
